credit.name: Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports of the Czech Republic
credit.note: C4Sys research infrastructure project (MEYS project No: LM20150055), and ELIXIR_CZ  project (MEYS project no. LM2015047)

function.cmd: Use the menu item Apps -> Genexpi -> Genexpi Wizard

publication.abstract: © 2018 The Author(s). Background: Identifying regulons of sigma factors is a vital subtask of gene network inference. Integrating multiple sources of data is essential for correct identification of regulons and complete gene regulatory networks. Time series of expression data measured with microarrays or RNA-seq combined with static binding experiments (e.g., ChIP-seq) or literature mining may be used for inference of sigma factor regulatory networks. Results: We introduce Genexpi: a tool to identify sigma factors by combining candidates obtained from ChIP experiments or literature mining with time-course gene expression data. While Genexpi can be used to infer other types of regulatory interactions, it was designed and validated on real biological data from bacterial regulons. In this paper, we put primary focus on CyGenexpi: a plugin integrating Genexpi with the Cytoscape software for ease of use. As a part of this effort, a plugin for handling time series data in Cytoscape called CyDataseries has been developed and made available. Genexpi is also available as a standalone command line tool and an R package. Conclusions: Genexpi is a useful part of gene network inference toolbox. It provides meaningful information about the composition of regulons and delivers biologically interpretable results.
publication.title: Genexpi: A toolset for identifying regulons and validating gene regulatory networks using time-course expression data

summary.description: CyGenexpi is a Cytoscape plugin for validating/inferring genetic networks from time series expression data. It is based on a ordinary differential equation (ODE) model of gene regulation.
summary.name: CyGenexpi
